title: Fundamental Valuation 101
text:

Warren Buffett once said, "It is far better to buy a wonderful company at a fair price than a fair company at a wonderful price".But what is a fair price? Wall Street uses a plethora of financial data and valuation metrics, which makes it hard to get a good grasp on a company's public valuation.In this webinar, we'll learn about different valuation metrics through comparative analysis - one of the leading valuation methods on Wall Street taught in MBAs around the world.We'll understand what data and which metric to use, understand what they measure, and how to use all of them together in order to create a valuation estimate.On the data side, we'll talk about Enterprise Value, EBITDA, and putting together a growth profile.On the valuation side, we'll focus on the PE ratio and two Enterprise Value ratios.By the end of this webinar, you'll be able to perform comparative analysis, understand its strengths and weaknesses, and tell for yourself whether a company is trading at a fair price, or at a wonderful price.Clement Thibault is a Senior Financial Analyst at Investing.com. He provides analysis and insights on the US stock market. Clement is an experienced public speaker, and has spoken at many financial conferences around the world. His analysis is regularly quoted in leading US media outlets such as the New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters, USA Today and many others. Analyzing stocks and educating investors are two of Clement's passions in life, which is why he focuses his webinars on actionable items to make you a better investor.
